data.event: Norwood as it is known today, grew out of the shadows of Potsdam, New York in the 1870s.
In 1871 the growing Potsdam hamlet became a village entered into existence as the "Village of Potsdam Junction."

event.title: April 15, 1875 a new name was voted

data.event: A short time later on April 15, 1875 a new name was voted on and Norwood was selected.

event.title: was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2004

data.event: The Benjamin Gordon Baldwin House was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2004.
